Cell.Data: FSB582-C Standards Model Summary for C
The LDRA tool suite® is developed and certified to BS EN ISO 9001:2000.
This information is applicable to version 9.4.4 of the LDRA tool suite®. It is correct as of 25th April 2014.

Compliance is measured against "C Coding Standard: Flight Software Branch - Code 582 Version 1.1" 2005 Copyright © NASA
Further information is available at http://aetd.gsfc.nasa.gov/code580

Header.x:Data: &CVersion 9.4.4 Copyright © 2014 LDRA Ltd. Copies of this document are not to be made or distributed.

Footer.x:Data: &CLDRA Ltd. reserves the right to change any specifications contained within this document without prior notice. The document was deemed correct at time of distribution.

Cell.Data: FSB582-C Standards Model Compliance for C
Header files shall have an extension of ".h" and body files shall have an extension of ".c".
Header files shall not generate object code (data or code).
Header files shall contain a set of preprocessor directives to ensure that they are not included more than once
A header file shall contain the following sections in the order.
A body file should not exceed 1000 lines of code and comments.
Functions that are not described in the header file shall have a block comment description.
Each function shall be terminated by a comment including the function name that indicates the end of the function.
A body file shall contain the specified sections.
The programmer shall only use ISO/IEC 9899:1990 - ANSI C statements.
Number of parameters does not match.
Array initialisation has too many items.
Array with no bounds in struct.
Use of // comment in pre-processor directive or macro defn.
Compilers shall be configured to enforce the ANSI standard.
All code should compile without warnings.
A standard set of options shall be used for each compiler/target.
All source files shall be edited using printable ASCII characters, with no tabs or form feeds.
Non standard escape sequence in source.
Source lines shall not exceed 120 characters in length.
Global identifiers shall be prefixed by a unique abbreviation of the unit name and an underscore (_).
Global Variable does not conform to style g_<name>.
Global Func Name does not conform to style <file>_<name>.
The library shall maintain a list of approved abbreviations
Identifiers should consist of more than one character.
Name found with length less than ***.
All names declared by #define statements shall be all uppercase letters
Macro name is not upper case.
All enumeration constants shall be uppercase.
Enum name is not all upper case.
Capitalization of ANSI C reserved words shall be as defined by the ANSI standard.
The capitalization of other identifiers should be mixed case.
The names of any two identifiers shall have unique spellings and not merely be distinguished by case.
An initial underscore shall not be used for any user defined names.
A boolean variable, or a function that returns a boolean result, should be named as specified.
The recommended indentation standard shall be followed.
{ or } not on line by itself.
The general coding style shall be consistent within each single file.
{ or } not on line by itself.
All code shall be indented a minimum of three spaces for each indentation level.
Statements at the same logical nesting level shall be at the same indentation level.
The indentation of a long or short comment inside a function shall be the same as the code it describes.
There should be only one statement per line.
Declaration statement not on new line.
Statement not on new line (added by Testbed).
Blank lines should be used between blocks of code that are functionally distinct.
Braces delineating compound statements should be on separate lines, with the opening and closing brace at the same indentation as the surrounding statements.
{ or } not on line by itself.
In expressions, operators should be surrounded by blanks, but not operators that compose primaries, specifically ".", "->"; and not between unary operators and their operands.
Space between unary operator and operand.
Space missing before or after binary operator.
* or & not attached to name in declaration.
Comment style should be a specified.
Exported global data for a component should be combined into a few global data structures
Only the unit that declares a global variable should write to that variable.
Variables with file scope should be gathered into a file scope data structure.
File scope variables shall be declared static unless the address of the variable is needed in the link map.
Function scope variables shall not have the same name as a file scope variable in the same file.
Duplicate use of a name in an enumeration.
Parameter has same name as global variable.
The justification for a static function scope variable shall be stated in a comment.
A function prototype should have the specified format.
Parameter not declared on new line.
The return value of all functions shall be explicitly typed.
File scope functions shall be declared as static, unless the function address is needed in the link map.
Each argument shall be explicitly declared in the argument list, with a name and a type. If a function does not require any arguments its argument list shall be declared void.
Procedure parameter has a type but no identifier.
Variable arguments shall not be used.
Ellipsis used in procedure parameter list.
The keyword const shall be used to modify the arguments wherever appropriate.
Pointer parameter should be declared const.
The preferred approach for global scope function prototypes is to omit the keyword extern.
A function definition should have the specified format.
Parameter not declared on new line.
The prototype definition comment is required if there is no corresponding prototype in a header file or body file; it shall be empty if there is a corresponding prototype.
The function prototype in the definition shall have the same layout as the corresponding prototype.
The argument names in the function definition shall be the same as in the corresponding prototype.
The opening brace of the function body should be alone on a line beginning in column 1. The matching closing brace should also be in column 1
{ or } not on line by itself.
Function scope variable declarations shall precede any code statements. There should be one local data declaration per line.
Declaration statement not on new line.
A function should do one and only one thing, and it should be kept short.
A function should not exceed two pages (200 lines).
Procedure exceeds *** source lines of code.
A function shall have a single entry point (no entry via goto) and it should have a single exit point.
Procedure has more than one entry point.
Procedure has more than one exit point.
A function should not have an excessive number of calling parameters.
The number of logical nesting levels within a function should not exceed four.
All variables shall be explicitly typed.
All types shall be declared with typedef, except that pointer types.
Structure tags shall not be used, except where required for forward references.
An if statement should have the specified format.
No brackets to then/else (added by Testbed).
An if-else chain should have the specified format.
Empty else clause following else if.
When testing a pointer for NULL, "if (pointer == NULL)" should be used, rather than "if (!pointer)".
A switch statement should have the specified format.
Switch case not terminated with break.
If one case falls through to the next case, make sure that it is fully commented.
The default case shall be present.
No default case in switch statement.
Default is not last case of switch.
Side effects within expressions should not be used.
Function has global variable side effects.
Potential side effect problem in expression.
Potential side effect from repeated function call.
Call has execution order dependant side effects.
Deprecated usage of ++ or -- operators found.
In the condition portion of an if, for, while, etc., side effects that extend beyond the guarded statement block should be minimized.
Function has global variable side effects.
Potential side effect problem in expression.
Potential side effect from repeated function call.
Call has execution order dependant side effects.
Deprecated usage of ++ or -- operators found.
#include statements shall include header files only.
Conditional compilation should be used only when absolutely necessary.
#define macros should be used to define constants that are shared among many files
Parentheses should be used when defining macro expressions.
#define shall not be used to redefine the C syntax or reserved words.
#define shall not be used to define new types.
#include statements shall not use absolute path names.
The following types shall be used when the size of data is important.
Typedef name has no size indication.
The common types shall be defined in the header file "common_types.h".
The type char shall only be used for data that is a string.
Operation not appropriate to plain char.
Inappropriate type - should be plain char.
For each processor, the "common_types.h" header file shall define one of the preprocessor constants __STRUCT_HIGH_BIT_FIRST__ or __STRUCT_LOW_BIT_FIRST__.
Bitfields shall have the specified format.
